intro: Bromus riparius, commonly known as the riparian brome, is a perennial grass species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows along riverbanks and wetlands, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet, which is often loosely arranged in a panicle. Bromus riparius plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates and small vertebrates.
